subject: Russ Mitchell: On The Trail Of Twisters
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 



       May 8, 
      2007


Hi, 
I'm Russ Mitchell and here's a 
      recap of today's "Early 
      Show."
We began with the latest on those tornados that swept through Kansas 
      and Oklahoma over the weekend. Hari Sreenivasan told us that 90 
      percent of the small town of Greensburg, Kan., has been destroyed. There will be 
      more tonight on the CBS Evening News. 
      
Also, I spoke with a storm chaser who shot some incredible 
      footage of tornados touching down in Oklahoma. Reed Timmer told us 
      he and his crew were less than 100
yards from one powerful tornado. He said he 
      hopes his videos that show the destruction tornados can 
      bring will teach all of us to take twisters seriously.
 
 
Dr. 
      Emily Senay was here to tell us about a fascinating new study on kids watching TV. The study shows 
      that many kids under the age of two are already heavy TV 
      watchers -- and 14-year old 
      youngsters who watch a lot of TV are more likely to do poorly in school. 
      
 
 
Correspondent Mark Phillips told us about last night's state dinner at the White 
      House for Queen Elizabeth. Tracy Smith continued 
      her series on "CSI:Miami" with some tips on how to get the "Horatio look" down pat. 
 
We saw 
      some cool gifts for Mothers' Day. 
      Hannah spoke 
      with actor 
      Dennis Haysbert and Julie interviewed Mel 
      Walsh, the author of a new book called "Hot Granny". It's full of 
      practical advice to help you stay health, happy and sexy in your golden 
      years. Yes, it really is called "Hot Granny"!
 
 
Lots 
      more tomorrow, including an inside 
      look at "CSI:NY." 
      See you then.
 
      


Russ 
      Mitchell
